ygData.subject: Re: RE:No Drop complexity was  [eqbards] minotaur horn change?
ygData.msgSnippet: I still don t see how that relates.  You are just confirming that you want that action sent to the server regardless of where you are standing.  Once you
ygData.messageBody:
I still don't see how that relates. You are just confirming that you
want that action sent to the server regardless of where you are
standing. Once you clicked yes, it would happen right where you
stand.

--- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...> wrote:
> ok here's one example. I drop item. Confirm window comes up. I
step onto
> the boat. Drop is no longer valid as objects cannot be dropped
while on
> boat.
>
> Another one. I drop item. confirm window comes up and I ignore it
and run
> halfway across the zone. I drop item, but I am too far away to
drop to
> location checked so it fails again.
>
> Its obvious confirm windows do not interrupt actions or the whole
group >6
> would not work.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: beatdropbattledrum@h...
> [mailto:beatdropbattledrum@h...]
> Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 3:08 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: RE:No Drop complexity was [eqbards] minotaur horn
change?
>
>
> What?
>
> --- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...>
wrote:
> > Yes but if you wait for a confirm window suddenly the drop action
> may no
> > longer be valid in the server side world. This is the simplest
> complexity
> > that could interfere.
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: beatdropbattledrum@h...
> > [mailto:beatdropbattledrum@h...]
> > Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 2:55 PM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: RE:No Drop complexity was [eqbards] minotaur horn
> change?
> >
> >
> > But it is a client side issue... if the client is set to not
drop,
> > the command never gets sent to the server that something is being
> > dropped. The client decides the action first.
> >
> > --- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...>
> wrote:
> > > It is absolutely a server side check. The dropped item gets
> > propagated into
> > > the virtual server side world when dropped. If they detect a
> drop
> > and then
> > > wait for a confirm the drop could become a trade
unnecessarily.
> > The destroy
> > > action does not involve any server side changes whatsoever
except
> > to your
> > > inventory. The drop action requires a check for target and
then
> > propagates
> > > the object dropped either into a trade window or onto the
server
> > side world.
> > >
> > > I seriously doubt it could simply be a client side flag given
the
> > > interaction with the virtual world that occurs. You can't drop
> > anything
> > > while you are in the middle of a casting animation either.
There
> > are
> > > innumerable things that occur with a drop action that do not
> occur
> > with a
> > > destroy because a drop action is not client side.
> > >
> > > Also note the trade option is allow others to trade with you.
It
> > turns you
> > > off as a viable target for give actions. It is clearly not a
> > client side
> > > only effect.
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@h...]
> > > Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 2:43 PM
> > > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > > Subject: Re: [eqbards] minotaur horn change?
> > >
> > >
> > > Argh
> > >
> > > It's not an item flag! It's an option in the client to just
not
> > allow you
> > > to drop items. It could be a no drop/trade switch for all I
care
> > so you
> > > just can't click it in an empty area. It has _nothing_ to do
> with
> > your
> > > equipment other than not letting you dump it on the ground.
> > >
> > > And to those who think it's a difficult code change:
> > >
> > > The client already checks to see if you are dropping the item
or
> if
> > you are
> > > giving it to someone. All they'd need to do is add a flag:
> > >
> > > If Drop and playerwantsdrops=yes then item drops
> > > Else item stays
> > >
> > > That's really rudimentary pseudo code but it would be VERY easy
> to
> > stick
> > > into the client code. It's not even a server side check.
> > >
> > > Lyrnia
> > >
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: "Jeffrey Sue" <jsue@r...>
> > > To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> > > Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 4:31 PM
> > > Subject: Re: [eqbards] minotaur horn change?
> > >
> > >
> > > > At 04:06 PM 6/2/00 -0400, you wrote:
> > > > >Uhh your options would only affect you, not others. Why
would
> > you not
> > > give
> > > > >that option to players on PVP servers? your private
settings
> on
> > your pc
> > > > >don't affect other players. It's a personal setting, just
> like
> > the
> > > 'prompt
> > > > >on destroy' option we already have.
> > > > >
> > > > >**tries to figure out why this is such a difficult concept
to
> > grasp**
> > > >
> > > > items flagged as no drop (currently with the NO DROP text in
> their
> > > description)
> > > > cannot be looted by others when they pvp kill you.
> > > >
> > > > yes i agree, i don't see why this is such a difficult concept
> to
> > grasp.
> > > oh, i guess
> > > > unless you have never participated in a pvp server and thus
> don't
> > know how
> > > it works.
> > > >
> > > > >Lyrnia Jongleur
> > > > >The Baffled Bard
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> >
>
